org.jdrupes.httpcodec.client

Class HttpResponseDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdrupes.httpcodec.HttpCodec
      • org.jdrupes.httpcodec.internal.Codec<T>
        • org.jdrupes.httpcodec.internal.Decoder<HttpResponse>
          • org.jdrupes.httpcodec.client.HttpResponseDecoder

  • public class HttpResponseDecoder
extends Decoder<HttpResponse>
    A decoder for HTTP responses that accepts data from a sequence of ByteBuffers.
    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

    • Method Detail

      • newResult

        protected DecoderResult newResult(boolean headerCompleted,
                                  boolean overflow,
                                  boolean underflow)
        Description copied from class: Decoder
        Factory method to be implemented by derived classes that returns a decoder result as appropriate for the decoder.
        Specified by:
        newResult in class Decoder<HttpResponse>
        Parameters:
        headerCompleted - indicates that the header has completely been received during the invocation of Decoder.decode(java.nio.ByteBuffer, java.nio.Buffer, boolean) that returned this result
        overflow - true if the data didn't fit in the out buffer
        underflow - true if more data is expected

      • decodeResponseTo

        public void decodeResponseTo(HttpRequest request)
        Starts decoding a new response to a given request. Specifying the request is necessary because the existence of a body cannot be derived by looking at the header only. It depends on the kind of request made. Must be called before the response is decoded.
        Parameters:
        request - the request

      • decode

        public HttpResponseDecoder.Result decode(java.nio.ByteBuffer in,
                                         java.nio.Buffer out,
                                         boolean endOfInput)
                                  throws ProtocolException
        Description copied from class: Decoder
        Decodes the next chunk of data.
        Overrides:
        decode in class Decoder<HttpResponse>
        Parameters:
        in - holds the data to be decoded
        out - gets the body data (if any) written to it
        endOfInput - true if there is no input left beyond the data currently in the in buffer (indicates end of body or no body at all)
        Returns:
        the result
        Throws:
        ProtocolException - if the message violates the HTTP protocol

      • newMessage

        protected HttpResponse newMessage(java.lang.String startLine)
                           throws ProtocolException
        Checks whether the first line of a message is a valid response. If so, create a new response message object with basic information, else throw an exception.

        Called by the base class when a first line is received.

        Specified by:
        newMessage in class Decoder<HttpResponse>
        Parameters:
        startLine - the first line
        Returns:
        the new HttpMessage object that is to hold the decoded data
        Throws:
        ProtocolException - if the line is not a correct request line
